intro.description: Welcome to the Synoptic Display Studio (SDS) Overview. To help you evaluating the application, we provide some example displays that can be run with a Soft-IOC. There are 5 steps to get it running.

item.title: 1. Install the example files
item.description:
Just click the link on the bottom and provide the name of the workspace project that should be created for the sample files.
If the link is missing here, you can also use the menu action under "CSS -> Display".

item.title: 2. Download and install a Soft-IOC
item.description: To run the examples you need a pre-configured EPICs Soft Input-Output-Controller (IOC), which should be available at http://css.desy.de. Please download it from there and follow the installation hints shipped with the IOC. Unfortunately the IOC only works on Microsoft Windows Systems.

item.title: 4. Check Preference Settings
item.description:
Please check CSS "Preferences -> CSS Applications -> Display -> Connection Service". To connect to channels that are provided by your Soft-IOC you need to choose "DAL" on this preference page.
Please do also check the EPICs settings on "Preferences -> CSS Core -> EPICs". If you are running a local IOC you have to add "localhost" to the "addr_list" setting.
If you could not install a Soft-IOC for any reason, you can give our JVM-local thread-based data simulator a try, which is independ from any IOC or control system stuff. It provides random double values for channel names with a "?rDouble" prefix.

item.title: 5. Open and Run Displays
item.description:
The SDS defines a workbench perspective that is optimized for developing displays. Select Window->Open "Perspective->Other->Display Development" in the menu bar at the top of the workbench. This step changes the perspective to set up the Eclipse workbench for Display development.
Use the workspace explorer on the the left to navigate to the project which contains the sample files. The file extension for SDS Display files is ".css-sds".
Doubleclicking one of the files in the workspace explorer will open the corresponding display editor. Using the display editor is straight forward. Further documentation will be provided soon.
To run a display, click the play-button in the editorÂ´s toolbar or use the context menu on the workspace explorer. You can run any display as a view or as a separate shell.
A good idea is, to arrange running displays in their own named perspective. The perspective layout is persisted and will pop up again, when you restart the CSS.
